results.title: Cottage gardens
results.creator_credit: Tracy Smith and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmanson and the Gardening Australia team provide all the information you need to create your own cottage garden. Planting, planning and design techniques are shown, and suggestions are made in regards to which plants should go where and why.

results.title: Patch from scratch
results.creator_credit: Colin Grubb and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Witness Peter Cundall transform a patch of exhausted lawn into a productive vegetable garden yielding a cornucopia of fresh organic vegetables. Over an 18 month period the viewer follows the cycle of sowing, fertilising and harvesting through Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter. Peter demonstrates how to rotate the beds with legumes, brassicas, root crops and companion plants to maintain healthy crops and fertile soil, and how to keep pests and diseases at bay. Vegetables shown being grown include Peas, Beans, Lettuce, Endive, Tomatoes, Cabbage, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Garlic, Sweet Corn, Pumpkin, Cucumber, Zucchini, Swedes, Carrots, Onions, Capsicums, Potatoes, Oca and Artichokes.

results.title: Pat and Eddy's greyhound racing family
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, Daniel Scharf, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Brian McKenzie documents the Seager family who are a family dedicated to the racing of their beloved greyhounds. The family has grown-up with the ritual of training, caring and racing the dogs, but as the teenagers grow up, their independent lives take them increasingly away from this family pursuit. Tenderly compiled with sometimes humorous but gentle observations of the family, we are led more deeply into the psyche of the Australian spirit.

results.title: Dickie bird: a bird's eye view of cricket
results.creator_credit: Brian Klein, Norman Giller, On the Box Productions and Video Collection International
results.brief_description: It is rare in a sport such as cricket that an umpire should have as much of a reputation and following as the players over which he adjudicates. Umpire Dickie Bird is a prime example of this exception to the rule. In this video he reflects on his most enjoyable moments from the game, reflecting on some of the greatest performances and players he’s seen, and culminates in Dickie donning the cricket whites to face one of the fastest West Indian bowlers ever.

results.title: Patricia's moving picture
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Ann Pearson, Kathleen Shannon, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Deals with the problems and frustration’s many women feel when they find that being a wife and mother at home does not fully occupy their time, and who do not find the stimulation they need to fulfil their lives and feel useful. Patricia wants to be “an individual” to be independent rather than the wife of Mr. Garner. (Awards: Melbourne, New York)

results.title: Pat Whalan's world of floral art. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Building on skills demonstrated in Part 1, Pat shows how to create a Victorian Posy, the Florist’s Posy, a formal bouquet with handle and an informal Table Arrangement using oasis.

results.title: Pat Whalan's World of Floral Art. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Australian gardening and radio personality, Pat Whalan demonstrates the skill of the professional florist. Learn how to make buttonholes, posies and corsages using special wiring techniques.

results.title: Dick Deadeye or duty done
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Steven Cuitlahuac Melendez and Bill Melendez Productions
results.brief_description: This animated jaunty rollick of music, comedy and quirky little characters is based on the orginal works of Gilbert and Sullivan (including some new lyrics by Robin Miller) and features the voices of Victor Spinetti, Peter Reeves, George A. Cooper, Miriam Karlin, John Newton.

results.title: Diary of a teenage smoker
results.creator_credit: Kari Skogland, Daphne Ballon, Rachel Low, Atlantis Films and Health and Welfare Canada
results.brief_description: Young women talk about the damaging effects that cigarettes have had on their lives. This video was produced with the cooperation and involvement of teenagers themselves. They recount their reasons for taking up smoking, the physical, emotional and financial costs of addiction, and their struggles to give up the habit. Never didactic, this straightforward account of tobacco addiction also uses dramatised sequences to explore the ways in which the cigarette industry targets young female smokers. Canadian comedian, Sandra Shamus, appears in the video delivering a monologue on her battle to give up the “deadly weed”.

results.title: Diana: story of a princess
results.creator_credit: Nick Ward, Phil Craig, Sally Brindle, Janice Sutherland and Brook Lapping Productions
results.brief_description: This four part television series is adapted from the book of the same name, retracing the life and mixed fortunes of Diana, Princess of Wales. The four part series features extensive interviews including: Diana’s staff, the press, royal biographers, photographers, friends, lovers, former colleagues as well as James Hewitt, Trevor Rhys-Jones and numerous people that Diana had met on tour. The documentary uses fictional “recreations” of certain scenes, voice-over narration and television footage to trace Diana’s life. Episode one: Diana’s life pre-royal marriage, her parents, birth, childhood, school years, employment in child care, engagement and marriage to Prince Charles, the rise of her popularity with the press. Episode 2: Ascendency of Diana’s fame and the press’s obsession with her, eclipsing Charles, cracks in the Royal marriage, the affair between Camilla and Charles, Diana’s popularity with the people and common touch. Episode 3: Diana’s affair with James Hewitt, the rival biographies, the Charles and Diana TV interviews, the divorce, Camilla gate, Diana gate, the rival camps and press obsession with the unravelling of the monarchy. Episode 4: Diana’s post-divorce suitors, fame in America, charity work with victims of landmines and AIDS, the press’s hounding of her, her romance with Dodi Al Fayed, death in Paris and subsequent public mourning of her life.
